edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.openSSL

Class OpenSSLRSAPermutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.TrapdoorPermutationAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.openSSL.OpenSSLRSAPermutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RSAPermutation, TrapdoorPermutation

    public final class OpenSSLRSAPermutation
extends TrapdoorPermutationAbs
implements RSAPermutation
    Concrete class of trapdoor permutation of RSA algorithm. This class wraps the OpenSSL implementation of RSA permutation.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • isElement

        public TPElValidity isElement(TPElement tpEl)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if the given element is valid in this RSA permutation.
        Specified by:
        isElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Parameters:
        tpEl - - the element to check.
        Returns:
        TPElValidity - enum number that indicate the validation of the element. There are three possible validity values: VALID (it is an element) NOT_VALID (it is not an element) DONT_KNOW (there is not enough information to check if it is an element or not)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given element is not a RSA element.

      • generateTPElement

        public TPElement generateTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TrapdoorPermutation
        Creates a TPElement from a specific value x. It checks that the x value is valid for this trapdoor permutation.
        Specified by:
        generateTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Returns:
        TPElement - If the x value is valid for this permutation return the created random element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given value x is invalid for this permutation

      • generateUncheckedTPElement

        public TPElement generateUncheckedTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TrapdoorPermutation
        Creates a TPElement from a specific value x. This function does not guarantee that the the returned "TPElement" is valid.

        It is the caller's responsibility to pass a legal x value.

        Specified by:
        generateUncheckedTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Returns:
        TPElement - Set the x value and return the created random element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
